title: Riot, please acknowledge that your client is hot garbage
body:
I won't call for firing of whoever created this garbage client, but please acknowledge that it's an utter embarrassment for a multibillion dollar company such as yours.

It is crazy that it took me whole month in summer to just INSTALL this game after having it uninstalled since march. 

The patcher, or launcher or installer or whatever you wanna call it kept giving me all kinds of different errors. 

Now, after all of that in the past month I've been getting bug splats, critical errors almost every single DAY. 

Yeah, yeah , I'm sure it has something to do with my PC but I didn't change ANYTHING, no hardware and everything is up to date. 

I had no prior issues until they started happening 1 month ago.

Hextech "repair" tool is a glorified reinstaller that does NEXT to nothing, and now I did the clean uninstall and tried installing the stupid game again and guess what? I AM GETTING THE SAME ERRORS I WAS GETTING IN SUMMER. 

"Patching failed and we're not sure why, please restart the client to restart patching" 

I restart client and boom same error again, and again and again. 

Why is this stupid patcher so buggy and glitchy, why? 

I can't even install the god damn game ! WTF?!

replies.body: Remember the old client? The one that didn't have a million bugs. I miss it.

Old client wasn't without it's problems, but, at least for me it worked way better than this new one. 

And also I feel like it had a lot more soul, aesthetically.

The new client is like my old truck; sure it wasn't pretty, sure it was out dated and had some issues, but it was a trooper and did the job we needed it to do. 

The new client doesn't crap we don't need or want for the sake of "shiny" and therefore can't do what we need half the time with random lagging, deciding to dodge people because they can't click on champs in champ select randomly, refusing to safe runes arbitrarily, and the list goes on.
Edit your post, edit it a lot. Enough to where we can make sense of it at least. Thank you.

Old client was much better and free from lags/bugs. The only problem it had, was high memory usage. Like 800- 1 gb of memory usage.

Yeah, that pretty much disappeared with this brand-new, shiny, modernistically beautiful and refined client we have now.

https://i.imgur.com/1lEizXK.png

754 MB memory use.

https://i.imgur.com/31IrRws.png

738 MB memory use, plus 15~20% processor use (four cores, relatively powerful).

An enormous 6 - 25% improvement in memory used as compared to what you remember. It is well worth the bugs, disconnections, seemingly random lag spikes, delay in changing tabs etc.
